Dear Mrs. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 11/30/24, a staff member threw a youth against the wall,
causing the youth to bleed.
Investigation Interviews:
DCWL Consultant was interviewed on December 10, 2024,
and reported they had no additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
December 11, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
Youth A said he is placed at Leppien House. Youth A said he was
recently “shoved to the ground” by Staff 1 and while on the ground
Staff 1 had his forearm across his throat for about a minute. Youth
A said Staff 2 and Staff 3 were standing there watching and did
not say or do anything about it. Youth A said he does not like Staff
1 due to personality differences, noting he has never hurt him prior
to this incident and is not mean to him. Youth A said he had a
scratch on the middle finger on his right hand and needed a Band-
Aid but had no other injuries.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
December 11, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
Youth B said he resides at Leppien house and gets along with
“most” of the youth and all the staff. Youth B said Leppien house
has “problems everyday” but most recently there was issues with
Youth A and other youth running around and hitting Staff 1. Youth
B said Youth A was running back and forth from the laundry room
attempting to fight Youth C and Staff 1 was trying to stop Youth A
by verbally redirecting and standing in front of him. Youth B said
Youth A got upset at Staff 1 and punched him and Staff 1 was
trying to stop Youth A and they both fell to the ground. Youth B
said Staff 1 was on top of Youth A with his forearm on Youth A's
chest and throat for “a couple of minutes”. Youth B said Youth A
2

was yelling “get the fuck off me, you’re on my neck”. Youth B said
Staff 2 and Staff 3 were present when this happened and just
stood there watching. Youth B said Staff 1 got up and then
everyone ran into the entryway area and all the other youth were
hitting Staff 1, pushing him, and throwing shoes at him. Youth B
said Staff 1 was telling them to stop and blocking the hits and
shoes while Staff 2 and Staff 3 watched. Youth B said Youth A
grabbed a pen and stabbed Staff 1 about “eight times” and Staff 1
pushed him away from him. Youth B said Staff 4 and Supervisor
arrived and all the youth “cooled down” and everything stopped.
Youth B said Staff 1 is a “good staff” and he does not think he was
trying to hurt Youth A but rather get him to stop trying to fight the
other youth and himself. Youth B said he is not aware of any youth
or staff having injuries.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
December 11, 2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Staff 1 said he has worked at Leppin House for two months. Staff
1 said on the evening of November 30, 2024, the youth were
running around the house and at one point Youth A and Youth C
got into the laundry room. Staff 1 said Youth A began to hit Youth
C so he moved in-between the youth to block Youth A from hitting
Youth C. Staff 1 said he briefly placed Youth A in a restraint
however let go quickly as Youth A is “triggered by being touched”
so he did not want to keep him in a hold. Staff 1 said they left the
laundry room and were in the hallway when Youth A turned around
and began hitting him. Staff 1 said he was attempting to place
Youth A in a restraint when they both fell to the ground. Staff 1
said he fell on top of Youth A who was on the ground on his back.
Staff 1 said he had his arm across Youth A’s “shoulder/collar bone”
as he was trying to get ahold of Youth A’s arm due to Youth A
hitting him. Staff 1 said he could not get any control and so got off
of Youth A. Staff 1 said all youth and staff ended up in the common
area where the youth were all hitting, kicking, and throwing items
at him. Staff 1 said Youth A got a pen and began stabbing him so
he was moving around the area trying to keep a distance from him
while dodging the other youth’s assaults. Staff 1 said he did not
want to leave the house or the area and have Youth A redirect his
angry towards Staff 2 and Staff 3. Staff 1 said one of the other
staff must have called for assistance at some point however he
does not know who. Staff 1 said he did not hear the other staff
offering to assist him. Staff 1 said he was unsure of what Staff 2
and Staff 3 were doing throughout the incident. Staff 1 said Staff 4
arrived at the house and tried to keep the youth away from him
while he was trying to move away from Youth A. Staff 1 said after
Staff 4 arrived the youth began to calm down, and Youth A ran out
3

of the house where Supervisor was at and began to talk to him.
Staff 1 said this is the first time Youth A was ever aggressive
towards him. Staff 1 said he did not intend any harm to Youth A
and to his knowledge Youth A had no injury. Staff 1 said Youth A
never said he was not able to breathe or reported being injured.
Staff 1 said he called the police and discussed pressing charges
on Youth A with them however decided against it.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
December 11, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff
2 said she has been working for Eagle Village for about three
months. On November 30, 2024, was her second time working in
Leppien house and first time working with Staff 1. Staff 2 said the
youth were all “horseplaying” and despite being redirected to stop
they continued, it escalated, and Youth A attempted to assault
Youth C. Staff 2 said Staff 1 attempted to place Youth A in a
restraint however it failed, and they fell onto the floor. Staff 2 said
Youth A was on the floor with Staff 1 on top of him with one hand
on the floor and one hand/arm across Youth A’s “stomach/chest
area”. Staff 2 said two other youth stated Staff 1 was choking
Youth A however Staff 2 said she was close to them and never
saw Staff 1 with his hands or arm near Youth A’s neck. Staff 2 said
Staff 1 and Youth A got up and walked into the common area
where all the other youth followed and several youths began to
punch, kick, and throw items at Staff 1. Staff 2 said there were so
many youths acting out and Staff 3 was standing “stunned” so she
did not attempt to restrain any youth but rather tried to stand in-
between the youth and Staff 1 and verbally redirect youth. Staff 2
said she had called for additional staff assistance and once Staff 4
got there the youth began to calm down. Staff 2 said Staff 1 was
deflecting blows from the youth and “defending himself”. Staff 2
said Youth A was not bleeding and she did not see any injuries
with him. Staff 2 said Youth A never reported he was hurt or
choked during or after the incident. Staff 2 said Staff 1’s demeanor
was making the situation worse. Staff 2 said she was trying to help
keep the youth separated however it was not working, and Staff 3
was “stunned” and not helping. Staff 2 said she does not recall
being trained to tap a staff out or ask them to remove themselves
from a situation during training. Staff 2 said she did not write any
incident report on the situation because Supervisor told her she
did not have to. Staff 2 said she did not suspect child
abuse/neglect from what she witnessed.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
December 11, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff
3 said she has worked for three months at Eagle Village and is
4

normally in Ashmun house however was assigned to work in
Leppien on November 30, 2024. Staff 3 said that evening Youth A
was chasing Youth C back and forth from the laundry room and
Staff 1 got in between them and tried to stop Youth A. Staff 3 said
Staff 1 and Youth A ended up in the hallway. Youth A had punched
Staff 1 and they fell to the ground. Staff 3 said Staff 1 landed on
Youth A with his forearm on Youth A’s neck. Staff 3 said she did
not say anything at the time as she was “in shock”. Staff 3 said
she does not recall Youth A making statements about being
unable to breathe or asking Staff 1 to get off him. Staff 3 said she
does not recall what Staff 1 was saying during the incident. Staff 3
said several of the other youth saw Staff 1 on Youth A’s neck and
began to get angry and hit Staff 1. Staff 3 said Staff 1 and Youth A
got up and all the youth ran into the entry way where she and the
other staff followed. Staff 3 said all the youth began to gang up
and fight against Staff 1. Staff 3 said Staff 2 tried to restrain but
was unsuccessful. Staff 3 said she and Staff 2 were verbally
redirecting the youth, but they were not listening. Staff 3 said Staff
2 called for additional support and Staff 4 arrived to help
deescalate the youth. Staff 3 said the youth all began to throw
boots and shoes at Staff 1. Staff 3 said Supervisor arrived and the
youth all settled down and stopped assaulting Staff 1. Staff 3 said
looking back she should have assisted Staff 1 and called for
additional staff earlier. Staff 3 said she had never worked at
Leppien house and was in shock at what was happening and just
froze. Staff 3 said she was not aware of Youth A being injured from
the incident.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
December 11, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff
4 said she was called to Leppien for help on November 30, 2024.
Staff 4 said when she arrived all of the youth except for Youth B
were hitting Staff 1. Staff 4 said Staff 2 and Staff 3 were verbally
redirecting the youth to stop but not physically assisting or
intervening in any way. Staff 4 said Staff 1 appeared to be
defending himself as she stepped in to separate the youth and
redirect them away from Staff 1 and the area. Staff 4 said the
youth began to calm down and the Supervisor arrived, and they all
stopped hitting Staff 1. Staff 4 said none of the youth voiced any
concerns about Staff 1 to her. Staff 4 said she never saw any
injury on Youth A. Staff 4 said she has no knowledge of Staff 1
choking Youth A. Staff 4 said Staff 2 and Staff 3 should have been
helping Staff 1 as they are trained to engage and assist each other
in situations like that.
5

Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
December 11, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
Supervisor said he was on call the night of November 30, 2024.
Supervisor said he was helping out at a different house on
campus when he got a call from Staff 2 and Staff 4 to come back
to Leppien house. Supervisor said once he returned to Leppien,
Youth B came outside upset. He was talking with him and got him
to return inside at which time Youth A came running outside
without any shoes on and was upset. Supervisor said Youth A told
him Staff 1 had thrown him into a wall and made him bleed.
Supervisor said he checked Youth A over and he was not bleeding
anywhere. Supervisor said Staff 1 then came outside and said
Youth A had a pen and had been stabbing him with it. Supervisor
said he got the pen from Youth A and directed Staff 1 to return
inside. Supervisor said Youth A began to go after Staff 1 at which
point he put him in a standing restraint for less than two minutes.
Supervisor said he was able to get Youth A to calm down and
return inside. Supervisor said he sent Staff 1 to another house to
finish the shift. Supervisor said Youth A did not have any marks or
bruises other than a small cut on his finger. Supervisor said Staff 2
and Staff 3 were in the house with Staff 1. Supervisor said Youth A
never told him he was on the ground. Supervisor said Youth A
never told him Staff 1 was choking him. Supervisor said none of
the other youth or staff told him that Staff 1 had Youth A on the
ground. Supervisor said he has supervised Staff 1 and never had
any concerns with him. Supervisor said after the incident he called
Residential Manager and told him what Youth A had said and that
he switched Staff 1 to another house. Supervisor said he did not
have concerns that Staff 1 had abused Youth A.
Residential Manager was interviewed face-to-face at the
facility on December 11, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS
worker. Residential Manager said he was on campus Saturday
night when the incident occurred however was not present in
Leppien when it happened. Residential Manager said Supervisor
called him and told him he moved Staff 1 to a different house due
to the youth having targeted him and assaulted him. Residential
Manger said Staff 1 met with the police however decided not to
press charges on Youth A. Residential Manager said he was never
told Staff 1 fell on Youth A or that he had his arm anywhere near
Youth A’s neck. Residential Manager said he did not see Youth A
that night. Residential Manager said Supervisor told him Youth A
punched Staff 1 and then the other boys joined in on beating Staff
1 up. Residential Manager said the following morning he debriefed
with Youth A about the incident and Youth A never mentioned
6

being injured and said he wanted to apologize to Staff 1 for his
behaviors.
Quality Manager was interviewed face-to-face at the facility
on December 11, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
Quality Manager said she trains Aegis behavior management
model, and they do not have a floor or ground restraint. Quality
Manager said the staff are trained to switch out or tap out with
staff if needed however it is not a written policy or procedure.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of November 30, 2024, Leppien House was
reviewed on December 11, 2024. The youth were running and
horseplaying throughout the hallways, and laundry room with the
staff following them starting at 5:46pm. At 5:48pm Youth A chases
Youth C into the laundry room and begins to punch him. Staff 1
followed right behind them and upon his entry into the laundry
room separates the youth and places Youth A in a benevolent
restraint for a few seconds then releases the hold. While Staff 1
had Youth A in the restraint, Youth C was still hitting Youth A and
no other staff were present. Once Staff 1 releases the hold he
faces Youth A and pushes him backward and then grabs each of
his wrists and is talking to him. Youth C exits the laundry room and
Staff 2 arrives in the doorway. Staff 1 and Youth A exit the laundry
room and as they walk down the hallway Staff 1 steps into Youth A
with his shoulder and then moves in front of him. Youth A pushes
Staff 1 in the back. Staff 1 turns and is pushing him backward and
then stands in front of him. Youth A pushes Staff 1 and Staff 1
pushes him back. Youth A comes towards Staff 1 and Staff 1 grabs
Youth A with one arm around Youth A’s chest/neck and the other
behind Youth A’s back. Staff 1 moves Youth A from one side of the
hallway wall to the other, moving his position to have one arm
around the back of Youth A’s upper shoulders/neck and his other
hand holding Youth A’s wrist above his head. Youth A is able to get
out of Staff 1’s hold and takes steps down the hallway as Staff 1
then grabs Youth A with both arms around Youth A’s waist and
turns him the opposite direction he was heading. Youth A swings
his arm towards Staff 1’s head and Staff 1 pushes Youth A
backward. Youth A falls to the ground taking Staff 1 with him.
Youth A lands on his back and Staff 1 is on top of Youth A facing
him. Staff 1 is seen with his right hand on Youth A’s left bicep and
his left hand on Youth A’s neck. Staff 1 moves his face very close
to Youth A’s face and then moves his left arm so his forearm is
across Youth A’s neck and chest area, holding him down with his
body. Staff 2 and Staff 3 are standing in the hallway watching the
incident. Youth A moves his legs and Staff 1 moves his left forearm
7

down from Youth A’s neck area to his chest. Two youth come into
the hallway and see Staff 1 holding Youth A on the ground and
begin to kick Staff 1. Staff 2 and Staff 3 move next to where Staff 1
and Youth A are laying on the ground and move their hands out
when the other youth come close however, they do not prevent
them from kicking Staff 1. Staff 1 holds Youth A on the ground for
45 seconds before getting up. Youth A gets up immediately after
Staff 1 and then pushes Staff 1 in the chest and Staff 1 steps back
towards Youth A. Youth A punches Staff 1 and Staff 1 grabs both
of Youth A’s arms as he is facing him and pulls him across the
hallway. Staff 1 puts Youth A’s back against the wall briefly and
then pushes him down the hallway. Staff 1 and Youth A go off
camera briefly and then are seen through a partially open door
facing each other, Youth A is swinging his arms in a punching
motion towards Staff 1 and Staff 1 is grabbing Youth A’s arms.
Staff 1 and Youth A go off camera briefly and then Staff 1 and Staff
2 come through the doorway with Youth A between them in a
standing restraint. Staff 1 and Staff 2 move Youth A into the living
room where Staff 2 loses her hold on Youth A and he swings his
arm and punches Staff 1 in the head. Youth A then runs across the
room. Staff 2 has her radio up by her mouth and other youth start
entering the living room. Staff 1 walks across the living room
following Youth A while other youth are seen hitting Staff 1 in the
back. Staff 1 is seen pushing Youth A backwards and then three
other youth circle Staff 1 and begin to push, kick, and hit him while
Staff 2 watches with her radio by her mouth. Youth A moves away
from Staff 1 and Staff 1 follows him around the room. Youth A
turns and faces Staff 1 and Staff 1 is seen pushing Youth A, while
three other youth are behind Staff 1 pushing, kicking, and hitting
his back. Youth A walks towards Staff 1 and Staff 1 steps
backward, three other youth then get in front of Staff 1 and hit,
kick, punch at him and he deflects their punches by moving his
hands in front of their arms. Staff 2 and Staff 3 are standing in the
living room watching the incident. Staff 2 moves in front of the
other youth to stop them from hitting Staff 1. Staff 1 faces Youth A
and is moving his mouth while the other youth run up and hit him
and then run away. Youth A moves around the room and Staff 1
remains in one place turning to continue facing him and is moving
his mouth. The other youth continue to run up and hit Staff 1 and
then move backward. Staff 2 is moving in-between the other youth
and Staff 1 with her hands out so they cannot get to Staff 1. Two
of the youth then are seen pushing and swinging their arms at
Staff 2. Youth A moves one of the youths away from Staff 2. The
youth are all seen pacing around the living room, Staff 2 is on her
phone briefly, Staff 3 is standing watching, and Staff 1 is in the
middle of the room moving his mouth. The youth begin to grab
8

shoes and throw them at Staff 1. Staff 4 arrives and is let in the
house by Youth B. Youth A approaches Staff 1 and slaps him
across the face then moves backward with Staff 1 walking towards
him. Youth A then punches Staff 1 and Staff 1 moves backward
and another youth runs in and punches Staff 1. Staff 1 pushes that
youth backward. All the youth run at Staff 1 and begin punching
him and then move backward. Youth A grabs the chest area of
Staff 1’s sweatshirt with his left hand and moves towards him
swinging his right hand in a repeated stabbing motion towards
Staff 1’s stomach and face. Staff 3 pulls Youth C away from Staff 1
and Youth A. Staff 2 and Staff 4 are standing between the rest of
the youth and Staff 1 and Youth A. Staff 1 grabs each of Youth A’s
hands and Youth A begins to kick him. Staff 1 moves forward and
his right arm around the back of Youth A’s neck and his left hand
holding Youth A’s right hand. Staff 1 pushes Youth A into the
corner of the entryway and is holding each of Youth A’s hands
facing him. Youth A gets out of the corner and has Staff 1’s
sweatshirt hood with his left hand and is punching him in the face
with his right hand. Youth C is pushing and hitting Staff 1 in the
back. Staff 1 pushes Youth A back and grabs one hand and
reaches for the other hand. Youth A continues to punch Staff 1
until Staff 1 pushes Youth A back off him. Youth A moves into the
living room area, Staff 4 is seen taking youth out of the living room
area, Staff 2 is seen moving towards the door and all youth stop
the behavior.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1 personnel file: There was no disciplinary record and
Staff 1 completed the required Aegis training on October
18, 2024.
• Staff 2 personnel file: Staff 2 completed the required Aegis
training on October 18, 2024.
• Staff 3 personnel file: Staff 3 completed the required Aegis
training on September 27, 2024.
• Eagle Village Therapeutic Holds policy was reviewed. The
policy outlines the use of Aegis for all restraints and
prohibits the use of supine holds.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per video review, Staff
1 did not utilize an approved restraint technique with Youth A
during the incident on November 30, 2024. Staff 1 was seen
pushing and pulling Youth A throughout the incident. Staff 1 was
seen with his arm around Youth A’s chest/neck area while
standing, with his hand on Youth A’s neck on the ground, and then
his forearm across Youth A’s chest area on the ground.
9

Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2024C0001099SI dated 2/21/24, CAP Approved 2/29/24
SIR 2024SIC0001785 dated 12/12/24, CAP Approved 1/30/25
Rule Code Sufficiency of staff.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of resident.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Staff members failed to intervene with youth.
Investigation Interviews:
DCWL Consultant was interviewed on December 10, 2024,
and reported they had no additional information.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
December 11, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
Youth A said he is placed at Leppien House. Youth A said he was
recently “shoved to the ground” by Staff 1 and while on the ground
Staff 1 had his forearm across his throat for about a minute. Youth
A said Staff 2 and Staff 3 were standing there watching and did
not say or do anything about it.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
December 11, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
Youth B said during the incident on November 30, 2024, Staff 1
was trying to stop Youth A and they both fell to the ground. Youth
B said Staff 1 was on top of Youth A with his forearm on Youth A's
chest and throat for “a couple of minutes”. Youth B said Youth A
was yelling “get the fuck off me, you’re on my neck”. Youth B said
Staff 2 and Staff 3 were present when this happened and just
stood there watching. Youth B said later they were all in the
entryway area and the other youth were assaulting Staff 1, Staff 2
and Staff 3 watched.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
December 11, 2024, in collaboration with the MDHHS worker.
Staff 1 said he has worked at Leppien House for two months. Staff
1 described the incident of November 30, 2024, noting he did not
hear the other staff offering to assist him. Staff 1 said he was
10

unsure of what Staff 2 and Staff 3 were doing throughout the
incident.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
December 11, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff
2 said she has been working for Eagle Village for about three
months. On November 30, 2024, was her second time working in
Leppien house and first time working with Staff 1. Staff 2
described the incident and said there were so many youths acting
out and Staff 3 was standing “stunned” so she did not attempt to
restrain any youth but rather tried to stand in between the youth
and Staff 1 and verbally redirect youth. Staff 2 said she had called
for additional staff assistance. Staff 2 said she does not recall
being trained to tap a staff out or ask them to remove themselves
from a situation during training.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
December 11, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Staff
3 said she has worked for three months at Eagle Village and is
normally in Ashmun house however had been assigned to work in
Leppien on November 30, 2024. Staff 3 described the evening as
being chaotic and stated throughout the incident she was “in
shock” and did not assist in the physical management of Youth A.
Staff 3 said she and Staff 2 were verbally redirecting the youth, but
they were not listening. Staff 3 said looking back she should have
jumped in and assisted Staff 1 and called for additional staff
earlier. Staff 3 said she had never worked at Leppien house and
was in shock at what was happening and just froze.
Quality Manager was interviewed face-to-face at the facility
on December 11, 2024, in collaboration with MDHHS worker.
Quality Manager said she trains Aegis behavior management
model, and the staff are trained to engage sooner and assist
coworkers when they are in restraint situations. Quality Manager
said the staff are trained to switch out or tap out with staff if
needed however it is not a written policy or procedure.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of November 30, 2024, Leppien House was
reviewed on December 11, 2024. During the beginning of the
incident in the laundry room and then hallway it is observed Staff 2
and Staff 3 are standing in the area watching the incident. When
Youth A moves his legs and Staff 1 moves his left forearm down
from Youth A’s neck area to his chest, two youth come into the
hallway and see Staff 1 holding Youth A on the ground, They begin
to kick Staff 1. Staff 2 and Staff 3 move next to where Staff 1 and
11

Youth A are laying on the ground and move their hands out when
the other youth come close however, they do not prevent them
from kicking Staff 1. At one point Staff 1 and Staff 2 come through
the doorway with Youth A between them in a standing restraint.
Staff 1 and Staff 2 move Youth A into the living room where Staff 2
loses her hold on Youth A and he swings his arm and punches
Staff 1 in the head. Staff 2 has her radio up by her mouth and
other youth start entering the living room. Staff 3 is observed
standing and watching the incident. Staff 1 is observed pushing
Youth A while Youth A and other youth are observed kicking,
punching, and throwing items at Staff 1. Staff 2 and Staff 3 are
standing in the living room watching the incident. Staff 2 moves in
front of the other youth to stop them from hitting Staff 1. The other
youth continue to run up and hit Staff 1 and then move backward.
Staff 2 is moving in between the other youth and Staff 1 with her
hands out so they cannot get to Staff 1. Two of the youth then are
seen pushing and swinging their arms at Staff 2. Youth A moves
one of the youths away from Staff 2. The youth are all seen pacing
around the living room, Staff 2 is on her phone briefly, Staff 3 is
standing watching, and Staff 1 is in the middle of the room moving
his mouth.
Documents Reviewed:
• Staff 1 personnel file: There was no disciplinary record and
Staff 1 completed the required Aegis training on October
18, 2024.
• Staff 2 personnel file: Staff 2 completed the required Aegis
training on October 18, 2024.
• Staff 3 personnel file: Staff 3 completed the required Aegis
training on September 27, 2024.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance as per staff and youth
interviews, and video review, Staff 2 and Staff 3 did not engage or
intervene when Staff 1 was on the ground with his arm on Youth
A’s chest/neck, or throughout the incident when the youth were
attacking Staff 1.
Conclusion Violation Established
12

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
